item.title: The miners make it to the end of the trail
item.author: Georgios Chatzitheoklitos,
item.description: Day 11 – Stage 11A Having set our minds on doing the alternative high route in pursuit of more stunning views, we agreed to leave at 7am. The girls were punctual as always, and at 7am they went to the boys tent to find them still sleeping! But the boys overslept after having a nightmare with the …

item.title: The trip must go on: moving on up in Corsica
item.author: Georgios Chatzitheoklitos,
item.description: Day Six: Stage Five A day behind our schedule due to the storm on day four, we began hiking at 6:30am just as the sun was rising. The first two hours were relentless climbing in 70mph winds that kept blowing us over. At the top, the wind was so strong that we could lean our whole body weight into …

item.title: Further adventures on the toughest trail in Europe
item.author: Georgios Chatzitheoklitos,
item.description: Day One: Stage 1A On the first day we began early, waking up at 5:15am. Kindly driven to our starting point in a small town named Calenzana by our host from the night before, we were nervous but eager to set off. We were all very silent during that drive, contemplating what lay ahead of us. …

item.title: Kicking off the year with the toughest trail in Europe
item.author: Georgios Chatzitheoklitos,
item.description: How it all started… Being an overly excited prospective student, I was reading all the emails sent by the college. There I stumbled upon the Imperial College Exploration Board and learned about all the student expeditions to various exotic places that the Board had previously supported. Any …
